answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.The most probable cause for the odd sensation could be neuropathy, a disorder of the nerves. Most common cause for neuropathy is diabetes.  It can also be due to metabolic disorders, vitamin deficiencies, infections and traumatic injuries. You may need proper evaluation by your GP, please consult him for a neurological assessment.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

question: My left ear goes numb multiple times a day for several minutes at a time. Most noticeably when I'm driving. There's no pain and it seems to be the inner ear and part of my head near the temple. What is this?
title: Random ear numbness
